intro: Mikaniopsis kivuensis, commonly known as the Kivu Mikaniopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Albertine Rift in eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as montane forests and is often found in areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
